paper_abstract: Godson2H is a complex SoC (System-on-Chip) of Godson series, which is a 117 mm2, 152 million transistors chip fabricated in 65 nm CMOS LP/GP process technology. It integrates a 1 GHz processor core and abundant high or low speed peripheral IO interfaces. To overcome on-chip-variation problems in deep submicron designs, many methods are adopted in clock tree, and PVT detectors are integrated for debug. To meet the low power constraints in different applications, most of state-of-the-art low power methods are used carefully, such as dynamic voltage and frequency scaling, power gating and aggressive multi-voltage design.
paper_title: A Robust and Power-Efficient SoC Implementation in 65 nm
